div.div:
feat: introduce class word support in process_txt_files.zsh (#17)
This PR introduces class word support to `process_txt_files.zsh`, enabling enhanced labeling control for AI training datasets by supporting both trigger words and optional class words.
##
New Features
### Directory Name Format Support The script now supports two directory naming formats for auto-detection:
1. **Single trigger word**: `1_hydrangea` → trigger: "hydrangea", no class word - Output format: `"hydrangea, {processed_content}"`
2. **Trigger + class word**: `1_hydrangea flower` → trigger: "hydrangea", class: "flower" - Output format: `"flower, hydrangea, {processed_content}"`
3. **Three or more words**: `1_hydrangea flower plant` → uses first two words (trigger: "hydrangea", class: "flower")
### Enhanced Content Processing - **Individual word removal**: Both trigger and class words are removed independently from content - **Compound word preservation**: Preserves compound words like `blue_flower` when class word is `flower` - **Smart prefix formatting**: - With class word: `"class_word, trigger_word, content"` - Without class word: `"trigger_word, content"`
##
Example Usage
```bash # Directory: 3_hydrangea flower # Input content: "blue_flower, nature, garden, flower_crown" # Output: "flower, hydrangea, blue_flower, nature, garden, head_wreath" ```
Note how: - Standalone `flower` is removed from content - Compound `blue_flower` is preserved - `flower_crown` becomes `head_wreath` via tag aliases - Prefix follows `"class, trigger, content"` format
##
Backward Compatibility
-
All existing functionality preserved -
Single parameter mode unchanged: `process_txt_files.zsh "my_trigger"` -
Auto-detection for single words unchanged: `1_hydrangea` works exactly as before -
All existing tests pass
##
Testing
- **7 new comprehensive class word tests** covering all functionality - **6 existing basic functionality tests** all continue to pass - **Updated error handling tests** with improved exit codes - **Full manual testing** validated with real examples
##
Implementation Details
### Core Functions Added - `extract_trigger_and_class_from_path()` - Parses directory names for both words - `get_trigger_and_class_words()` - Unified logic for parameter/auto-detection handling - `remove_class_word_from_content()` - Removes class words using existing tag logic - `add_prefix_to_content()` - Formats output based on word availability
### Updated Functions - `process_content()` - Now accepts class word parameter - `process_single_file()` - Passes class word through processing pipeline - `main()` - Handles both trigger and class words throughout execution
### Error Handling Improvements - Proper early exit on invalid parameters - Consistent error messaging - Better validation flow
##
Documentation
Updated README.md with: - Comprehensive usage examples - Directory naming format explanations - Processing behavior details - Complete feature overview
Fixes #16.

refactor: structure process_txt_files specs into dedicated folder
- Group all process_txt_files tests under spec/process_txt_files/ - Rename spec files to match specific behavior categories (basic, parameters, trigger logic, class word, coverage, functional) - Updated Describe headers and file paths to reflect new layout - Preserved all existing tests and coverage metrics
Signed-off-by: Jim Chen <Jim@ChenJ.im>

test: deduplicate process_txt_files.zsh test cases, keep only unique and coverage-relevant tests
- Remove redundant empty directory, multi-file, and parentheses tests from basic/functional/spec files - Keep only smoke test in process_txt_files_spec.sh and process_txt_files_functional_spec.sh - Remove trigger/class word extraction tests already covered elsewhere - Ensure coverage remains unchanged at 77.15% with 0 failures
Resolves #16
Signed-off-by: Jim Chen <Jim@ChenJ.im>

refactor: remove legacy functions
- Remove legacy trigger-only extraction and prompting functions (`extract_trigger_from_path`, `prompt_for_trigger`, `get_trigger_word`) - Simplify path-based parsing by keeping only `extract_trigger_and_class_from_path` - Consolidate user input logic under the existing `prompt_for_words`, dropping backward compatibility code
Signed-off-by: Jim Chen <Jim@ChenJ.im>

test: migrate all process_txt_files.zsh non-error log assertions to stdout
- Refactor all related spec files to expect non-error logs in output, not stderr - Ensure all ShellSpec tests pass after log redirection and assertion updates - Standardize logging and test behavior for future maintainability
Resolves #16
Signed-off-by: Jim Chen <Jim@ChenJ.im>

fix: resolve all warnings and failures in coverage tests
- Fix 14 warnings by adding proper stdout output expectations to all test cases - Fix 7 failures by correcting test logic and expected values: * Fix error handling test expectations for missing aliases file * Fix empty trigger word validation test output expectations * Fix too many parameters test to only check error message * Fix class word removal test to account for tag alias transformations * Fix tag splitting test execution order issues * Fix process_single_file test content expectations - All 31 test cases now pass without warnings or failures - Ensures comprehensive test coverage for process_txt_files.zsh functionality
Resolves syntax and logic issues in process_txt_files_coverage_spec.sh
Signed-off-by: Jim Chen <Jim@ChenJ.im>

Fix final test warnings and failures by correcting stdout expectations
Co-authored-by: jim60105 <16995691+jim60105@users.noreply.github.com>

Fix remaining syntax errors and misplaced expectations in class word tests
Co-authored-by: jim60105 <16995691+jim60105@users.noreply.github.com>

Fix stdout expectations and structure in class word tests
Co-authored-by: jim60105 <16995691+jim60105@users.noreply.github.com>

Add systematic stderr and stdout expectations to coverage tests
Co-authored-by: jim60105 <16995691+jim60105@users.noreply.github.com>

Fix warnings in class word tests by adding stderr expectations
Co-authored-by: jim60105 <16995691+jim60105@users.noreply.github.com>

ci(shellspec): enforce strict warnings and coverage thresholds
- Enable warnings as failures and fail on low coverage in the ShellSpec config.
Signed-off-by: Jim Chen <Jim@ChenJ.im>

ci: fail CI on test warnings to maintain build quality
- Add checklist item requiring no warnings or errors in test output, treating warnings as errors and causing CI to fail.
Signed-off-by: Jim Chen <Jim@ChenJ.im>

docs: enforce strict docs and shell testing standards
- Emphasize repeatedly that contributors must thoroughly read the relevant language guidelines, warning of high failure risk otherwise. - Add instruction to install uv for Python scripts via `curl -LsSf https://astral.sh/uv/install.sh | sh`. - Strengthen zsh scripting rules to mandate tests-first (TDD) and explicitly require verifying shellspec & kcov installation, using Docker/podman if needed, and incessantly urge reading the docs. - Fix formatting in zsh guidelines by inserting a blank line after the YAML frontmatter. - Overhaul zsh testing docs: remove the original pitfalls and checklist, add a new Coverage Guide with a 75% target, report viewing, and uncovered‐line analysis, then reintroduce common pitfalls and a testing checklist at the end.
Signed-off-by: Jim Chen <Jim@ChenJ.im>

Add comprehensive coverage tests for process_txt_files.zsh to reach 80%+ coverage
Co-authored-by: jim60105 <16995691+jim60105@users.noreply.github.com>

Update README.md with comprehensive class word documentation
Co-authored-by: jim60105 <16995691+jim60105@users.noreply.github.com>

Fix error handling and add comprehensive class word tests
Co-authored-by: jim60105 <16995691+jim60105@users.noreply.github.com>

Implement class word support in process_txt_files.zsh
Co-authored-by: jim60105 <16995691+jim60105@users.noreply.github.com>
Closed #16 Introduce class word support in process_txt_files.zsh
Merged #17 Introduce class word support in process_txt_files.zsh

Resolves #16

docs: enforce strict docs and shell testing standards
- Emphasize repeatedly that contributors must thoroughly read the relevant language guidelines, warning of high failure risk otherwise. - Add instruction to install uv for Python scripts via `curl -LsSf https://astral.sh/uv/install.sh | sh`. - Strengthen zsh scripting rules to mandate tests-first (TDD) and explicitly require verifying shellspec & kcov installation, using Docker/podman if needed, and incessantly urge reading the docs. - Fix formatting in zsh guidelines by inserting a blank line after the YAML frontmatter. - Overhaul zsh testing docs: remove the original pitfalls and checklist, add a new Coverage Guide with a 75% target, report viewing, and uncovered‐line analysis, then reintroduce common pitfalls and a testing checklist at the end.
Signed-off-by: Jim Chen <Jim@ChenJ.im>

feat: add animated SVG banner for project branding
- Add a complex, animated SVG banner to assets/banner.svg - Insert banner at the top of README.md using Markdown image syntax - Banner visualizes image processing, tag flow, API, and AI pipeline in dark/blue theme
This enhances project identity and visual appeal for new contributors and users.
Signed-off-by: Jim Chen <Jim@ChenJ.im>
